attachments.title: Samsung Graduates Third Lot In Kenya Engineering Capacity Development Project
attachments.text: Sixty students from Samsung Engineering Academy graduated today at the Nairobi Serena Hotel. This wasÂ the third group to graduate from the academy since it was started in 2012. According to Samsung Electronics East and Central Africa Vice President and COO Robert Ngeru, more and more of their products were being sold, therefore there was a
attachments.fallback: Techweez: Samsung Graduates Third Lot In Kenya Engineering Capacity Development Project

text: hey guys, so we're doing a job facilitating a 21st marketing crash course for the Inter-American Development Bank as part of their Smart Cities thing, there's a startup contest with like 20 of the best urban-good startups in LatAm

typically for this group I'll do a "10 Contagious Commandments" type presentation and activity where I share some of our values, some of the work we think lives up to these values, and then ask them to almost re-write these values for their peers who might also be looking to start up a venture in LatAm

I was thinking, it might be fun to present the challenge to them, what sort of advice, or cheerleading, or encouragement would you give Cuban entrepreneurs who are looking to kind of join the broader www community across the world, how would you give them a handshake and hug or whatever along with a 'welcome to the neighborhood' startup community kinda attaboy.
that info, whether that's maybe video messages, or whatever, could then be carried into the cuba initiative and presented as some live action stuff
timing-wise IDB is like end-Sept so it'd probably be fairly fresh
